summary: This document is an email chain from July 21, 2023, forwarding a message from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen regarding Leon Black's $62.5 million settlement with the US Virgin Islands over the Epstein probe. Christensen expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against Black and references an attorney representing ten women who allege sexual assault.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Individual who paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands in settlement over the Epstein probe, with additional allegations of payments to individual women and sexual assault.

connections.description: Christensen is commenting on Black's legal situation regarding the Epstein probe and advocating for criminal charges.

keyFacts: Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands in a settlement related to the Epstein probe.
The $62.5 million payment does not include payments made to individual women.
Jeanne M. Christensen states that one lawyer represents ten women who allege Leon Black sexually assaulted them.
Christensen expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against Leon Black.
The communication references the overlap of this matter with 'Epstein/Maxwell'.
